intro: Carum bupleuroides, commonly known as slender caraway, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and dill. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent. The fruit, which is a type of dry, schizocarp, contains aromatic compounds similar to those found in other members of its family.
